stimulusHtml:
2 A(g) + B(g) → 2 C(g)

When the concentration of substance B in the reaction above is doubled, all other factors being held constant, it is found that the rate of the reaction remains unchanged. The most probable explanation for this observation is that
choicesHtml: the order of the reaction with respect to substance B is 1
substance B is not involved in any of the steps in the mechanism of the reaction
substance B is not involved in the rate–determined step of the mechanism, but is involved in subsequent steps
substance B is probably a catalyst, and as such, its effect on the rate of the reaction does not depend on its concentration
